question: A 4670-g male newborn is delivered at term. Examination shows swelling and crepitus over the left clavicle with decreased movement of the left upper extremity. Which is the most appropriate next step?
A 66-year-old man presents with fatigue and pallor. Lab shows hemoglobin 8.0, leukocytes 80,000, platelets 34,000. Blood smear shows immature cells. Which diagnosis is most likely?
A 40-year-old man has 5 months of watery diarrhea and weight loss. Exam reveals a systolic murmur. What is the greatest risk?
A 4-year-old boy presents with severe abdominal pain and bilious vomiting for 6 hours. Exam shows distended abdomen with guarding. What is the appropriate management?
A 9-year-old girl presents with headache and double vision after head trauma. Exam shows head tilt and left eye hypertropia. What is the likely cause?
A mother brings her 3-year-old son for tantrums occurring every other morning and twice weekly in evenings. Boy is well-behaved at daycare. What is the likely cause?
